Dear Ms. Crawford:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/30/23, youth was supposed to be raking leaves outside of
facility and was unhappy about it. Staff member and facility
leadership pulled youth to the ground and then leadership stepped
on youth's face with their shoe. Youth was then hit in the head
with their own sandal resulting in a mark on the forehead. Youth's
shoulder was also hurt.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Therapist was interviewed on 10/23/23 via
phone. Therapist reported Youth B told her about the allegations
during a therapy session. Therapist did not have any further
information outside of what’s listed in the allegations.
2

Licensee Designee (LD) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 10/6/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. LD
reported when he arrived at the facility, he asked Youth B to rake
the yard. He reported Youth B was not happy with his assignment,
but LD explained to him everyone at the facility performs a task to
provide help and support. Youth B took the rake and began raking
the front yard. Shortly later, he came to the back of the facility,
threw the rake, and said “I’m not doing this. Fuck off!”. Youth B
began running towards the front of the facility and LD said, “come
on, let’s talk about it”. Youth B said “No fuck you. I hate it here”.
LD reported as Youth B was running towards the front, he tripped,
fell, and skinned his elbow. LD reported Youth B threw his sandals
at LD, so LD picked them up. LD reported Youth B then got up,
ran, and charged at LD. When Youth B charged at LD, he tripped
again and fell by LD’s legs. LD reported Youth B put his arms
around LD’s legs, and LD stepped out of his grasp. LD reported
when he was stepping out of Youth B’s grasp, his foot lightly
brushed against Youth B’s face. LD reported he and Administrator
talked to Youth B and tried to calm him down, but Youth B wasn’t
responding. Youth B grabbed a grill pan and was swinging it
around. Youth B finally responded to de-escalation and verbal
prompts, so he put the grill pan down. Youth B asked LD for a
hug, and they hugged. LD reported they talked it out, and then
Youth B went into the house and took a shower because he was
muddy. LD reported he never hit Youth B with a sandal, never
pulled him and never stepped on him. LD reported Administrator
never pulled on Youth B. LD reported Administrator tried to help
Youth B up after he fell. LD reported he didn’t see Youth B hit his
head on anything.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
10/6/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
reported Youth B has a history of physical and verbal aggression.
Administrator reported on 9/30/23, he went outside and noticed
LD was below the stairs to the deck talking to Staff 1, who was on
the deck. Administrator reported Youth B was in the front yard
raking the grass. Administrator reported he went to talk to LD and
Staff 1. While they were talking, Youth B began walking towards
them and said something like “I’m not doing this anymore” and
threw the rake. LD encouraged Youth B to make responsible
choices because everyone must complete chores. Administrator
reported Youth B was swearing at LD and said “I’m not doing shit.
I’m out of here bitches”. Administrator reported Youth B was
wearing some slip-on sandals and one of them was broken.
Administrator reported Youth B started running down the driveway
3

towards the street when he stumbled and fell. Administrator and
LD were walking down the driveway following him and LD picked
up one of Youth B’s sandals. Youth B was cussing and rolled
over. Youth B took his other sandal off his foot and said, “I’m
going to hit you” and then threw it at LD. Administrator reported
LD picked up the second sandal and began walking backwards on
the driveway. Administrator reported he was trying to de-escalate
Youth B by talking to him and trying to figure out what was going
on. Youth B then began running and charged at LD. While he was
running, Youth B fell again and rolled next to LD’s legs. Youth B
grabbed onto LD’s legs and LD stepped his feet out of Youth B’s
grasp. Administrator reported he was still trying to help Youth B
calm down, but Youth B wasn’t responding. Youth B grabbed a
metal grill plate off the grill and began swinging it at LD and
Administrator. As a result of de-escalation and verbal prompts,
Youth B put the metal grill plate down and got off the ground. LD
was talking to Youth B about making appropriate decisions and
choices. Youth B asked LD for a hug, and LD gave him a hug.
Administrator reported they continued to talk to each other as they
all went into the house. After entering the home, Administrator
helped Youth B get showered and cleaned up because he was all
muddy. Administrator reported he didn’t see Youth B hit his head
on anything when he fell either time. Administrator reported LD
never hit Youth B or stepped on Youth B. Administrator reported
he and LD never pulled Youth B on any part of his body.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at school on 10/6/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he did not
see anything happen between Youth B, LD, and Administrator on
9/30/23. Youth A reported he has never seen any staff put their
hands on any youth because they’re not allowed to. Youth A
reported Youth B antagonizes all the staff and youth in the home,
so he doesn’t get along with Youth B.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on 10/6/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported there isn’t
anything he dislikes about the facility, LD, or Administrator. Youth
B reported on 9/30/23, he was upset because he was told to go to
his room, and he doesn’t like staying in his room. Youth B
reported he went outside to calm down. Youth B reported he was
on the curb, but Staff 1 came out and asked him to sit on the
porch instead, so he did. Youth B reported he went inside to eat
lunch, but then went back on the porch to wait for LD to arrive.
Youth B reported when LD arrived, he told Youth B to rake leaves,
so Youth B took the rake and went to the front yard. LD came to
the front of the building and Youth B reported he complained
4

about doing yardwork and told LD he should get a professional to
do it. Youth B reported he put the rake down and went running,
but he was wearing slip on sandals, so he tripped and fell. Youth
B reported he skinned his left elbow a bit. Youth B reported he
took both of his sandals off and threw them at LD, but he missed
hitting LD with both. Youth B reported LD picked up the sandals
and held onto them. Youth B reported he told LD he wanted his
stuff back, but LD didn’t listen. Youth B reported LD was yelling at
Youth B because he wasn’t listening to LD, but Youth B cannot
remember anything LD said or yelled at him. Youth B reported he
ran at LD because he was mad and when he got close to LD, LD
put his hands in fists in front of his body. Youth B reported
Administrator and LD were trying to get him to the ground. Youth
B reported he grabbed LD’s legs so LD couldn’t move his legs.
Administrator was trying to get Youth B off LD’s legs by pulling
Youth B’s arms off him. Youth B reported he then slipped to the
ground and hit his head on the wall or the grill but couldn’t
remember which. Youth B reported LD was trying to keep him on
the ground by stepping on the side of Youth B’s face while he was
on the ground. Youth B reported Administrator watched everything
and told LD to stop. Youth B reported LD eventually stopped and
told Youth B to get up, but Youth B stated he wasn’t getting up
and wasn’t going to listen to him. Youth B reported Administrator
put Youth B’s sandals by the stairs, but LD picked the sandals up
and hit Youth B on the left side of his face with one of the sandals.
Youth B reported he was crying and said “ow”. Youth B reported
he started to calm down and LD asked Youth B why he was acting
this way. Youth B reported he told LD he was upset because he
wanted to talk to his sister but hadn’t been able to see her
because she lives out of state. Youth B reported LD helped him up
and said something to him, but Youth B couldn’t remember what.
Youth B reported when he went inside the house, he took a
shower because he was all muddy. He reported after the shower,
he calmed down completely and felt like a whole different kid.
Youth B reported his shoulder hurt the next day and he was seen
by a doctor on 10/5/23, but nothing was found to be wrong.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 10/6/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on
9/30/23, Youth B woke up agitated and cussed her out because
he didn’t like what she was telling him to do. Youth B flipped her
off, said “the hell with you” and walked outside onto the porch.
Staff 1 reported she allowed him to sit outside and calm down to
give him some space, because it normally works. Shortly later,
Staff 1 reported she took the youth for a walk and Youth B joined
in. When they got back to the house, Youth B still didn’t want to go
5

inside, so Staff 1 allowed him to continue to sit on the porch
outside. After a while, Staff 1 asked Youth B to go rake the yard,
which he responded well to at first. LD arrived at the facility while
Youth B was raking. Staff 1 was on the deck and was talking to
LD, who was standing on the ground below her. While they were
talking, Staff 1 saw Youth B throw the rake and heard him say,
“fuck you bitches” while walking towards LD. Staff 1 decided to go
inside the home with the other youth, so she didn’t see anything
afterwards. When Youth B entered the home shortly after, she
asked him if he was okay and Youth B said he fell, but that’s all he
disclosed to her. Staff 1 reported Youth B and his clothes were
dirty, so he took a shower. Staff 1 reported on Monday 10/2/23,
Youth B complained about his shoulder hurting, but Staff 1
reported he complains about his shoulder all the time and reported
it is from an injury he received when he was younger.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email from MDHHS Worker dated 10/5/23 stating she
spoke with Physician Assistant (PA). PA reported he
examined Youth B, Youth B had no abrasions on his face.
He had full range of motion, no tenderness, and no
soreness in his shoulder.
• Emergency Department Note dated 10/5/23 authored by
PA. Youth B reported this past Saturday 9/30/23, he ran
into a wall and, since that time, has had intermittent pain to
his right shoulder. X-Ray was conducted on right shoulder
and there were no concerns.
• Pine Way Positive Behavior Support Plan for Youth B dated
7/12/23 notes a few of his identified challenging behaviors
include property destruction, verbal threats of harm and
verbal aggression.
• Incident Report dated 9/30/23 authored by Administrator
was consistent with Administrator’s interview.
• Pine Way Group Behavior Management/Intervention Policy
outlines positive intervention strategies to assist residents.
It also addresses appropriate behavior modifications,
including utilizing de-escalation, verbal prompts, and
revoking privileges.
• Pine Way Group Discipline Policy outlines discipline
prohibited by the facility, which includes corporal
punishment inflicted in any manner and restraining youth.
6

• Pine Way Group Aggressive/Assaultive Youth Policy
outlines steps staff must take when a youth becomes
aggressive or assaultive. Staff will talk calmly, provide
support as needed, use verbal de-escalation techniques
and other trauma informed techniques.
• LD has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. LD’s new hire training record
was received noting LD received Orientation and Skill &
Technique Training (which includes behavior management
training) on 6/25/21. Note: document says 6/25/2001, but
CA reported that was in error as they weren’t open in 2001
and it should instead say 6/25/21.
• Administrator does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Administrator’s new hire training record was
received noting Administrator received Orientation on
5/27/22 and Skill & Technique Training (which includes
behavior management training) on 5/30/22.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. There is no evidence to support Youth
B was hit with a sandal, pulled to the ground, or stepped on.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff
Section training.
Description (3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum of
50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually
thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At least 16 of the
50 hours provided in the first year shall be orientation provided
prior to the assumption of duties.
Violation Additional Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility only provided initial hire trainings for staff and did not
provide documentation of any trainings thereafter.
Investigation Training records for Administrator and LD were requested on
10/6/23, 10/11/23 and 10/16/23. On 10/17/23, CA reported she
would have administrative staff send the training records. The
training records for Administrator and LD were requested again on
10/18/23, 10/20/23 and 10/23/23. Training records were received
on 10/24/23. However, the training records only included New Hire
Trainings for LD and Administrator. On 10/25/23, Consultant
7

requested further clarification on what the trainings documented
consisted of and how often they must complete trainings. A
response was not received, so a follow-up email was sent on
10/27/23 requesting the same information. CA responded on
10/27/23 and provided clarification on what the trainings consisted
of and noted staff are to have 50 hours of training within the first
year after hire and 32 hours of training per year after the first year.
On 10/27/23, Consultant requested clarification regarding why
there were not trainings for LD since 6/25/21 and Administrator
since 6/1/22. CA responded on 6/27/23 and noted the facility
wasn’t in existence in 2001, so the training record should reflect
LD’s trainings were completed in 2021. CA noted they maintain
the requirements of minimum training hours (as noted above). On
10/28/23, Consultant requested all training records completed
after Administrator and LD’s new hire trainings be sent. A
response wasn’t received, so a follow up request for the records
was made on 10/31/23 and it was requested the records be sent
by the afternoon on the same day. LD responded and stated they
lost their administrative help, and they would try to get the
information to Consultant the same day. As of 11/6/23, training
records have still not been received.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• LD’s new hire training record was received noting LD
received Orientation and Skill & Technique Training (which
includes behavior management training) on 6/25/21. Note:
document says 6/25/2001, but CA reported that was in
error as they weren’t open in 2001 and it should instead
say 6/25/21. No further training documentation was
provided or documented.
• Administrator’s new hire training record was received
noting Administrator received Orientation on 5/27/22 and
Skill & Technique Training (which includes behavior
management training) on 5/30/22. No further training
documentation was provided or documented.
Analysis Based on communication with the facility outlined above, this
violation is established. Facility failed to provide training records
for Administrator and LD showing they participated in a minimum
of 50 clocked training hours within the first year of employment
and a minimum of 25 hours of training annually, thereafter, related
to the employee’s job functions.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
